meanings.definition: To last longer than; to continue to exist after
meanings.sent1: The old tree will outlast the new saplings in the forest.
meanings.sent2: I hope our friendship can outlast any challenges that come our way.
meanings.sent3: The marathon runner knew he could outlast his competitors with his steady pace.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed will outlast any doubts or fears.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins stand as a testament to the civilizations that outlasted time itself.

meanings.definition: To endure longer than; to outlive
meanings.sent1: The sturdy oak tree will outlast the harsh winter storms.
meanings.sent2: I believe true love can outlast any distance or time apart.
meanings.sent3: The little engine that could outlasted all the other toys in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: Her memory will outlast the passing years, always cherished in our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The bond between siblings can outlast any disagreements or arguments.
